document.masterDocTitle: A checklist of bat-associated macronyssid mites (Acari: Gamasina: Macronyssidae) of Russia, with new host and geographical records

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Steatonyssus ( S .) superans
.—Evans &

;

;

;

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality:
Primorskiy Region
(as Maritime Province )
.

Type host:
Vespertilio sinensis
(as
Vespertilio superans
).

Material. F (with intrauterine egg) ex
Vespertilio murinus
from biological station “Preduraliye”, 3 July 2012 , leg. O.L. Orlov, M. V . Orlova; F ex
V . murinus
from State Nature Reserve “Samarskaya Luka”, 7 July 2016 , leg. D.G. Smirnov; 4 FF, 8 MM , 6 N1 ex
V . murinus
from Novouralsk town, 18 July 2010 , leg. O.L. Orlov; 2 FF, M, 3 N1 ex
V . murinus
from Ekaterinburg, 13 September 2016 , leg. O.L. Orlov; 21 FF (including 16 with intrauterine egg), 3 MM , 14 N1 ex
V . murinus
from Pervouralsk town, 20 July 2015 , leg. O.L. Orlov; 8 N1 ex
Myotis petax
from Tigirekskiy State Natural Reserve, 2 March 2016 , leg. A. V . Zhigalin; 2 FF, 13 N1 ex
V . murinus
from biological station “Kolarovo”, 9 August 2014 , leg. A. V . Zhigalin; 3 MM , 22 N1 ex
V . murinus
from Nizhnee Beloe lake, 4 July 2016 , leg. D.G. Kazakov; 2 FF (both with intrauterine egg) ex
Plecotus ognevi
from Adun-Chelon, 26 July 2015 , leg. D. V . Kazakov; 62 FF (including 57 with intrauterine egg), 16 MM , 243 N1 ex
V . murinus
from Adun-Chelon, 26 July 2015 , leg. D. V . Kazakov; 3 FF (with intrauterine egg), 8 MM , 348 N1 ex
Vespertilio sinensis
from Adun-Chelon, 24 July 2015 , leg. D. V . Kazakov.

Distribution outside Russian Federation :
Asia (Kazakhstan, Tajikistan— Stanyukovich, 1997 ; Korea—Ah & Radovsky, 1967 ).

Hosts.
Vespertilio sinensis
( Bregetova, 1956 ; as
Vespertilio superans
—
Medvedev et al ., 1991
; present paper),
V . murinus
(Zemskaja 1951;
Zhovtiy et al ., 1962
;
Orlova et al ., 2015d
; present paper),
Myotis petax
(present paper),
Eptesicus nilssonii (
Medvedev et al ., 1991
)
,
Plecotus ognevi
(present paper).
Eptesicus serotinus ( Beron, 2014 )
,
Nyctalus lasiopterus aviator ( Beron, 2014 )
.
